main.name: Hunter Siebel
main.description: To comply with Stanford honor code, my work samples are  password protected. Please email me if you would like access
main.bio: I am a computer science major with a focus in artificial intelligence and a minor in international relations, graduating in 2021. I am hard-working, a faster learner, and work great in a team enviorment. I am eager to learn and expand my professional skills.
main.contactmessage: Please fill out the form below to contact me if you would like to know more about my previous work, expirence, or have any other questions!

resume.skillmessage: Here are a few of my most valuable skills

education.description: At Stanford I've learned valuabe project and time management skills. I've also learned how to work independently and have developed excellent problem-solving abilities.

education.degree: Global Politics of Protest and Change
education.description: My time at the London School of Economics was an enlightening expirence about the politics of social movements and change from an international perspective.
At Menlo I was involved in the school's community service organization and worked as a peer tutor. I took away great organization, teamwork, and leadership skills from my time at Menlo.

work.title: Product Management Intern
work.description: I created a system to manage the maintenance of lighbulbs for building and factory owners that leveraged IoT and AI technologies. The project was built on the C3 type system using JavaScript and TensorFlow. I also improved and tested new versions of C3's customer training platform.

work.company: Institute for Stem Cell Biology and Regenerative Medicine at Stanford University
work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: I performed many expirements to explore the lineage of embroyic stem cells that involved  DNA extraction and replication, measuring gene expression, and cell culturing. At the lab I  was responsible for  data analysis, data recording, and ordering of lab supplies for future experiments, which was fundamental for day-to-day lab operations.

work.title: Notetaker
work.description: I transcribed detailed records of lectures and other class information for a variety of subjects, creating an improved body of academic resources for qualifying students. I sumbitted organized and professional notes 4 times a week for the entirety of each course.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
